name: Hannah Morris
text: Wonderful, educated and SAFE daycare!

name: Stephen Sweeney
text: Our son has been at Heritage Preschool for almost 3 years.  They truly have an exceptional focus on childcare while providing quality child development.  Even as a toddler, we don't refer to it as daycare because it is so much more.  We refer to it as school at they have been a true partner in the education and development of our child.  They keep us informed of his progress and what they are working on so we can reinforce at home.  We have been very pleased with Heritage and would recommend them to anyone seeking a childcare solution.

name: Mark VanHooser
text: We love Heritage! There have been times, as a first time parent especially, that we and I had no idea if we were doing the right things to help our daughter learn and grow.  The teachers and staff do an excellent job in helping to not only guide us in those areas, but encourage us! There is even a Potty Training Boot Camp that helped us tremendously!!  We now have two little ones enrolled and have been attending for four years.  We wouldn't dream of going anywhere else.  We have never had a bad experience with any of the teachers or staff and our kids love them!

name: Maria Martinez
text: I have 2 kids that love going to Heritage. My daughters always have a big smile on their face when I drop them off and my oldest always tells me she had a great day. Julie, Mary, and the 3B teachers have made the transition of me returning back to work so positive by taking care of my youngest daughter who absolutely loves them!  My oldest has thrived under Mandy and Kathryn teaching her in PreK. The entire staff at Heritage is amazing and I can't say enough great things about them. They all have been so kind, caring, and patient with my kids.

name: Brittany Ledbetter
text: We absolutely love Heritage. When we decided to move our daughter to the school after having multiple issues with the previous daycare we had her in, Mr. Paul was so very helpful and did everything he possibly could for us to insure we had a smooth transition and could get her out of the other environment quicker. Along with Mr. Paul, all of the teachers and staff have been wonderful! We are very grateful to be apart of the Heritage Family.

name: Mallory Hilderbrand
text: We've been a Heritage family for over six years with both of our children starting around ten weeks old as infants. The staff, parent communication, and care are all excellent. We've grown to love this place and trust Heritage with our most precious little people. When I hear stories from other (even more expensive) daycares from my friends, I am often reminded of how grateful I am for this school.

name: Maija Galloway
text: I love the warm welcome every time I walk in to drop off my child or pick them up.  All the teachers are so loving on my child. It warms my heart to see my child run to give a teacher a hug.

name: Suzanne Crisanti Boos
text: My daughter is in infant 2 and she is adjusting very well. Her teachers pay close attention to her and what she needs. The facilities are also kept very nice and clean! The front staff also greets children by name and recognizes parents!

name: Ola Janik
text: My son's teacher was very nice and had many years of experience in childcare. The place is big and clean with nice classrooms and playgrounds. That being said, on the wobbler class, they have twice the number of children per teacher according to State regulation suggestion. Because of that it seemed like all the kids do is sit and wait on stuff. Diaper changes, feedings, and snacks take forever. The kids just sit strapped into a chair probably half the day, if not more. My biggest problem with them is that they did not take any  COVID precautions for the kids or parents (they take temperatures of everyone that comes in in our new daycare) and my son got COVID from there his first week. I know it was from there because we didnt take him to stores or in public because of social distancing. When we informed them of this, they shrugged it off and said something like, at least kids aren't that badly affected by it. I bet they didn't inform any of the other parents in his class. It's really expensive too and you have to provide everything. Also they don't support hand washing or potty training till later classes. Not a good fit for our kid but I'm sure it's fine for others

name: Jessica Brown
text: We absolutely love this daycare. Our child started at 6 months old and the teachers have always been so wonderful to him. They greet him each day with big smiles, help him when he refuses to nap :), and clearly love him which is so important to us as parents. He gives them huge smiles at the end of every day - so I know he loves them as well.They keep him on a great schedule, which we now copy on weekends. We had no idea where to send our son initially but feel incredibly lucky to have found Heritage as our home!

name: William McCandless
text: We have just finished with multiple years at Heritage preschool.  The first day of my child's new school we received a note from the teacher saying it was like he had been there all year.  I attribute that readiness to my child, parenting, and the time we spent in Heritage.  I feel my child is prepared and ahead.  I highly recommend them.  More than most types of places you get what you pay for; at Heritage we always felt safe, it was always clean, and the communicate from the staff was excellent.   We would make the same decisions again knowing what we know now.

name: Meaghan-Elizabeth Morris
text: We have three children who started at Heritage this week (7 month old twins and a 3 year old). We worried about the transition for our 3 year old but she continues to be excited to go everyday. The teachers and staff are so helpful and caring. We are already seeing the advantages of the curriculum in our 3 year old and are excited to watch her grow at Heritage.

name: Jonathon Whitehead
text: We love this place! I never thought I would feel comfortable leaving my infant at a daycare/preschool, but Heritage seems to be on top of things.

name: Jonathan Williams
text: This will be my second child to come through Heritage Preschool.. once my now 9 year old  left Heritage he was ahead of his kindergarten class in writing and all.. the staff there are all consistent and very loving to my kids and my family. Very family friendly..  We also love “parents night out” . A very much needed rest and intentional date night on a quarterly bases away from 3 kids (3,9,12)-1

name: Kendal Etu
text: Our son has been at the CCS Research Park location since he was 3 months old. I cried every time I thought about taking him to daycare until I actually had to take him. The staff at CCS have been wonderful to us. They know my son by name and greet him every morning and afternoon. His teachers have been amazing and so very patient with us. As first time parents we tend to over analyze everything. I can't say enough good things about our experience with this school. I truly feel like they love our son and are investing in his future.

name: Michelle Thompson
text: The teachers and staff are amazing! Our little girl has learned so much and is very happy there.

name: Nichole Hache
text: This isn't a daycare, this is a family!!! Our daughter has been going to CCS Research Park since she was 1 year old. She has been doing so great there. I use to be nervous to take her to daycare and knew she would scream and cry when I would drop her off, but at CCS she is happy to be there and doesn't scream or cry. The staff feels so much like family and they are quick to comfort and help her and comfort and help me when both my daughter and I are having separation anxiety moments haha. My daughter and cerebral palsy and has to wear a leg brace and therapy services, the staff at CCS are so quick to help with her brace and with therapy while playing, and they allow her therapist to come to daycare, which helps my husband and I so much. She is excelling everyday and I am just amazed and what all she has learned and continues to learn. No child is pushed to move any faster than the child has to. They let the children mature and grow in everything at the child's pace before moving to a older class. Which as a mother I am thankful that they our daughter move at her pace and not expected to be like all the other children. I will never go to another daycare, it makes me nervous just thinking about leaving CCS. They are a wonderful family who we have just grown to love and happy to see everyday.

name: Heather Ellett
text: My child has been at CCS for eight months.  He's currently in the wobblers classroom, and we love it.  His teachers are great with all the children.  In a previous review, I saw it mentioned the children were being "tied to a chair".  My job allows a lot of flexibility in my schedule, so I will drop off and pick up at various times of the day.  I have never seen my child, nor anyone else's, tied down.  They have small chairs the children sit in, and there is a strap with a buckle that goes over their lap.  They will buckle them in while they're eating lunch or snack to keep them from falling out.  These children are still small and aren't used to sitting in armless chairs by themselves yet.  They will use these same chairs for timeout.  My son likes to try to stand up and climb on everything, so I'm glad they buckle him in to keep him from falling out or standing up and then falling and potentially hurting himself.  The teachers not buckling him in his chair would be a safety concern for me.  They have lesson time and they are taught letters, numbers, colors and sign language.  My son is 15-months old, and he will do sign language for various words, and he's learning so many new things all the time.  We are greeted every morning when we come in, and all the staff know my son by name.  I'm very happy with CCS, and the teachers in the wobblers room seem to truly care about the children in their care.

name: Brandon Howard
text: I am so appreciative of the folks at CCS. My daughter loves to go to school, she loves all her teachers. It's nice when we are leaving that everyone that works there knows her name and says goodbye. The facility is clean, safe and the playground areas are great. The staff is attentive and caring, especially when my daughter was apprehensive about school at first. I highly recommend CCS.

name: Nichole Hache
text: This isn't a daycare, this is a family!!! Our daughter has been going to CCS Research Park since she was 1 year old. She has been doing so great there. I use to be nervous to take her to daycare and knew she would scream and cry when I would drop her off, but at CCS she is happy to be there and doesn't scream or cry. The staff feels so much like family and they are quick to comfort and help her and comfort and help me when both my daughter and I are having separation anxiety moments haha. My daughter and cerebral palsy and has to wear a leg brace and therapy services, the staff at CCS are so quick to help with her brace and with therapy while playing, and they allow her therapist to come to daycare, which helps my husband and I so much. She is excelling everyday and I am just amazed and what all she has learned and continues to learn. No child is pushed to move any faster than the child has to. They let the children mature and grow in everything at the child's pace before moving to a older class. Which as a mother I am thankful that they our daughter move at her pace and not expected to be like all the other children. I will never go to another daycare, it makes me nervous just thinking about leaving CCS. They are a wonderful family who we have just grown to love and happy to see everyday.

name: The Mental Fit Chick
text: I ABSOLUTELY LOVE CCS (Research Park Location) ! The learning environment is ABSOLUTELY GREAT! This school is like the HARVARD or YALE for preschools within the Huntsville/Madison Area! Each grade level has great instruction and the classical approach way of teaching has been amazing for my son! We brought him to the school because he wasn't being challenged where he was and within 2 weeks he knew all of his alphabets, vowels and knew what his constants were as well; We have been there about 5 months and he is on his way to reading and he is only 3!  The Business aspect is handled properly and that is important also because again this was like our 5th day care and although Christian Daycares are GREAT BUSINESS IS BUSINESS! The teachers are professional and Gossip amongst them with parents is nonexistence. The environment is clean, safe (you have to have codes to get into every door), and overall a joyful atmosphere!

name: Heather Ellett
text: My child has been at CCS for eight months.  He's currently in the wobblers classroom, and we love it.  His teachers are great with all the children.  In a previous review, I saw it mentioned the children were being "tied to a chair".  My job allows a lot of flexibility in my schedule, so I will drop off and pick up at various times of the day.  I have never seen my child, nor anyone else's, tied down.  They have small chairs the children sit in, and there is a strap with a buckle that goes over their lap.  They will buckle them in while they're eating lunch or snack to keep them from falling out.  These children are still small and aren't used to sitting in armless chairs by themselves yet.  They will use these same chairs for timeout.  My son likes to try to stand up and climb on everything, so I'm glad they buckle him in to keep him from falling out or standing up and then falling and potentially hurting himself.  The teachers not buckling him in his chair would be a safety concern for me.  They have lesson time and they are taught letters, numbers, colors and sign language.  My son is 15-months old, and he will do sign language for various words, and he's learning so many new things all the time.  We are greeted every morning when we come in, and all the staff know my son by name.  I'm very happy with CCS, and the teachers in the wobblers room seem to truly care about the children in their care.

name: Josh Langford
text: Our child recently started attending CCS and each and every time we step foot in the Research Park campus we have been made to feel like family. We are very particular about who watches our child and we feel very comforted he is in such a welcoming, learning and loving environment.

name: V H
text: I called this daycare simply asking if they had any openings. The girl that answered said they had 2 openings and even wanted to see if I could come in to tour the facility. I then advised my son was dx with autism and if they were they inclusive. I was placed on hold. The director picks up and says they don’t have any openings and that the two positions had been filled and paid for. Oh, really? Funny, how when I was transparent the conversation changed. I would have appreciated it better if they would have simply said they are not equipped. Even though my son is not aggressive, he simply needs a little bit more hands on attention. I would’ve preferred er an honest answer versus what I was given. I would never try to enroll my son somewhere where the teacher and staff where incapable of meeting his needs.

name: Ami Joy Scarbrough
text: I’m literally sitting in a place that mandates marks AND a statewide mandate is in place while a director ahd I assume a franchise owner are sitting in a public place discussing COVID19 guidelines with no masks! I’m not a fan of masks either but this certainly doesn’t give me much reassurance that my child would be safe at AK if two individuals in management don’t take the County and State Health department mandates seriously. It’s a shame because I’d planned on enrolling my son after having visited before COVID19. I think I will pursue other avenues.

name: Sabrina Miller
text: I am very grateful for the School For Amazing Kids' staff (including Tina, Dana, and Teresa).  My son has a new diagnosis of autism (high functioning), and they have been very helpful with helping him through his separation anxiety and speech delay.  They personally directed us in the right direction for his speech, and  have went out of their way to comfort him when he has a break down.  Their reassurance has helped me tremendously. They all are a huge blessing to us.

name: Morgan Stepek
text: They have been a wonderful change from our previous childcare. We love the teachers and directors. Everyone has been so caring and helpful. The atmosphere is truly child focused and my son is so much happier!

name: Bethany Aultman
text:
This school does truly live up to its name! It is absolutely amazing. My son has attended here since 2017, and the care he has received has been incredible. His teachers from previous classes still come and check on him. I honestly don’t ever worry about him during the day, and I know he is being loved on while I have to work. I would honestly be lost without this daycare! My son tells me all of the time, “ thank you for sending me to school today.” He’s 3!!
The staff and directors are pretty amazing too!

name: Benjamin L
text:
My wife and I love The School for Amazing kids. We just had our first child this year and we knew going back to work would be tough. He started at 10 weeks old and has done fantastic in their care. He is 6 months old now. We couldn't ask for better people to be watching our newborn. I feel very safe leaving my son their each day because I know he is in good hands. I like knowing they have a camera system installed throughout the building and that no one can check in or out with out providing a finger print.
Their hours each day are long enough to give us time after work to get there and pick him up. They keep track of when he eats and sleep. It's like getting a report each day about his day. The staff in the infants room is fantastic! They stick to the feeding schedule we requested and will do anything we ask.

name: Courtney Shugart
text:
This is truly the best daycare. We started our girls here back in February and the difference in my three year old has been night and day. We struggled a lot before with her listening and following direction. Since starting Amazing Kids, she has blossomed. She listens to us now and loves to follow directions. She loves her teachers and constantly talks about them and all they have taught her.

Not only has this daycare program helped our daughter, it has helped us too! The teachers are always more than happy to answer our questions and give us guidance when we need it. They offer such a nurturing environment for our children. We were so nervous in the beginning, as we had always had our girls kept at home but, the staff at Amazing kids made the transition much easier than I ever imagined. They answered all the crazy questions we had and never once made us feel like we were overthinking it. They have truly become a second family for us and our girls.

name: Todd Mashburn
text: We absolutely love Morningstar!  The staff and teachers that work there are awesome and they always have a smile on their face!  They are great with the children and our child can't wait to get to "school" every morning.  We also like the fun, seasonal activities that Morningstar provides for both the children and the parents.  These activities allow for the parents of the children to get together, to meet and talk to the teachers and for the children to have an awesome time playing!  We highly recommend Morningstar Child Care if you are new to the area!

name: Erica Roberson
text: Walked in to my son’s classroom one day to find him on the floor of the bathroom with his pants down, door open, and a kid pointing and laughing at him. The teacher sat at her desk and did nothing. I asked for security footage to be reviewed and was told it was a live feed and not recorded. I’m giving more than one star because the director assisted us all he could and I understand there’s not much you can do when you don’t have evidence. My son had a few good teachers, but there was one that he said was really mean to him. He’s doing much better now that he’s in public school.

name: Katrina Ackerman
text: We absolutely love Morningstar Daycare. As, first time parents, it was important for us to find a place that we were comfortable with dropping our girl off at.  The teachers really seem to care about each and every child that comes through those doors. It is reassuring to see your child smile when you hand her over to the teacher. We could not have chosen a better place for your daughter to go!  Hands down the best place!!!!

name: Brandi Hicks
text:
My daughter started attending Morningstar 10 months ago and we have been extremely happy.  We have grown to know and love the teachers there and were welcomed with open arms.  It is so comforting to know that my child is in great hands while we are at work.  Many of the teachers have become just like family to us and are so kind and caring.
The education that she is given at Morningstar has been wonderful in getting her prepared for 5K next fall.  We are so thankful for Morningstar and their staff.

name: RaNetta Underwood
text:
Caring Staff
It is a very hard and even an emotional time when a parent drops their child off for daycare for the very first time and this was definitely the feeling I had when I had to finally go back to work after spending 9 wonderful weeks with my newborn; but I will say that taking her School for Amazing Kids, Calera made that transition just a little more easier than it would normally be. I remember the first day, her lead teacher, Crystal, welcomed us with a very warm greeting and immediately took my daughter for a first time bonding moment. At that moment, I knew I had made the right choice in child care for my daughter.

The staff is so friendly and they speak every time you see one of them, even if they are not the teacher of your child. They really love on the children and it reflects heavily with my daughter when I can drop her off with no hesitation from her. She happily goes to the teachers and I feel like they really care for her and her well-being. They are as well caring of the parents, by offering conversation every time you are in their presence. This is the kind of relationship that you want when you entrust your child with a child care facility for more hours than they are at home with you.  This was the most important thing to me when I was looking for child care and I know I found it in School for Amazing Kids, Calera.

name: Kevin Taylor
text:
I really like the School for Amazing Kids located in Calera. The school is super accessible and conveniently located for parents that have to work. It is a very good value for the money that you pay and what you get out of it. My wife and I are paying less here for my two children to go to this school where they LEARN than our previous childcare arrangements. Best of all they have a full school schedule. What I mean by that is I don't have to take off from work to watch my kids because they are closed.

On top of ALL that value the school is great because of what my children have learned and how they have developed academically. I know they will be ready for the next step. The staff is great, my kids and myself enjoy all the teachers; especially Mr. Jonathan.

name: Cory French
text: Our family is very pleased with School for Amazing Kids in Calera, Al. The location is excellent, right off 65, and is very convenient for dropping off before and after work.  The teachers are awesome and they really take the time to work with each child.  Our child has transitioned from the bottle to a sippy cup/table food and has started walking with ease, because the teachers have really invested time with her.  We highly recommend School For Amazing Kids.

name: Kendall Collum
text: Morningstar is an awesome place to send your kids to daycare. Within a week, my son (3 years old) was able to recognize words and letters and my daughter (1 year old) knows where her eyes, mouth, nose, and ears are. Every staff member is genuinely concerned with the children there and it shows! I would recommend Morningstar to anyone!

name: SoulofBleuz
text:
My husband and I absolutely love Shepherd's Promise. Our son was 7 months old when he started at the daycare. Needless to say, we were nervous because his grandmother kept him for us during the day while we worked. Little did we know, our precious bundle of joy warmed right up to his teachers as well as his fellow classmates.

Since attending Shepherd's Promise, our baby has become so independent. It is hard to keep up with him! The teachers are so nurturing which made the transition for our son easy. We highly recommend this great daycare to new parents. You will not be disappointed.

name: E Atkinson
text: Morningstar is just what we were looking for, close to home and a clean and safe environment for our child. They offer many great programs and activities during and after business hours such as parent lunches and parents' night out. Who doesn't need that?? My child loves getting up to go to school and see his friends. Walking into his room, there is a list of what they are learning for the week, which even includes a bible verse. I also love when my child's artwork gets to come home with us. It is those things that I will always cherish. Thank you Morningstar for loving my child as much as I do.

name: Katie Allen
text: I absolutely LOVE this child care facility or should I say SCHOOL. I bounced my son around for a while from daycare to daycare and the "teachers" weren't taking time with him, he wasn't learning what he needed, wasn't getting the attention he needed and I was about to throw my hands up until I found Morning Star. It is perfect, he gets up in the mornings ready to go see his friends and teachers ( which he never ever use to do ) and he actually had a struggle with his colors for a while and once he got into a classroom at morning star with his amazing teachers he just stared coming home each day, learning something new and he was so excited and I am so proud of him he now comes home and knows his colors! So thank you to his awesome teachers and such a fun learning facility for my son!

name: Jetta Johnson
text: We love Morningstar!  My child has been there since she was 8 weeks and we've had nothing but positive experiences in 4 1/2 years. I can't imagine going anywhere else.  The teachers are great and is nice that most of the children have been there as long as we have.  We've basically all grown up together like family.

name: Amy Lynn Butler
text:
My 2 ½ year old toddler is ready to take on the world! And Morningstar Daycare supports his desire for discovery and need for independence, while also providing a sense of safety and security.
In his present class, the teachers actively partner with the parents to help your child learn important independent life skills, such as potty training and hand washing.

I really like the balance they have with teaching: Child-Initiated: the children play and explore throughout their day, and they develop an understanding of their world. And Teacher-Guided: Teachers use a developmentally appropriate instructional framework to help stretch children’s minds by demonstrating, asking questions, encouraging and guiding.

My child has been going to Morning Star for over 1 1/2 years. I love it that every day he comes home with a new art project he did, or singing new song, sharing something new he’s learned.  I know at Morningstar my child is learning and thriving, happy and safe.

name: Brooke O'Brien
text:
Our first child started with Morningstar when she was 9 months old.  I was a new mom and was not excited about leaving my child with strangers for 10 hours a day.  In addition, my family is not religious, and I'm an atheist, so I trying to find a secular daycare in my area was next to impossible.  We looked at multiple facilities and ultimately settled on Morningstar.  While I'm not keen about the religious instruction (biblical stories and praying at meals), the facility is always clean and the teachers are well mannered, and trained in early childhood development.   The facilities are kept up-to-date with new equipment and decor.  The directors are always happy to listen to my latest worry or concern about my daughter, her behavior, or the latest news of the day.  Parents are allowed to visit for meals and their adoption of a "parent's night out" is a treat my husband and I look forward to each month.

My daughter is now 3 and the teachers understand when to introduce structured discipline.  My husband and I have started using the same techniques at home so that my daughter can have consistency and a better understanding of what's right and wrong.  When my son recently joined our family, there was no question where he would go.

We have had incidents in the past of biting, falls, sickness, etc. and the staff were always prompt in notifying me and informing me of any additional needs they have.  I am completely at ease with my kids being in their care and know that they love them as much as I do.

I would like to see more teachers in the classrooms, but they are following DHR guidelines for adult/child ratios.  However, I understand what that would mean for tuition rates.

My daughter is well cared for, well mannered, well educated, and well socialized (as a 3 year old can be).  And for that, I'm willing to put up with some minor annoyances about religion from time to time.

name: Peggy Huckabaa
text:
My daughter started at Morningstar Child Care when she was 9 months old. She loved going to school, playing with her friends, and seeing her teachers. She graduated from 4K with a beautiful ceremony that my grandparents still talk about today. Since they are currently in their 80's, they will not have the opportunity to see her graduate from High School. It was a moment we will all treasure.

My daughter still stays in touch with some of her friends she made at Morningstar. She is now a First grader. Her Kindergarten and First Grade teachers have made comments on how advanced she is compared to some students who did not go to Morningstar. Her reading and math levels are above the expectation for each semester and in some circumstances even for the year. Morninstar gave her a great start to her education. We are extremely happy with the love, care, and learning Morningstar has given her.

name: Diana Sprayberry
text: I absolutely love this daycare.  My child has been attending Morning Star since he was 2.  If I have ever had any issues they have always been very helpful and resolve the situation. I would recommend this daycare to anyone..

name: Kelli Kirk
text:
Both of my daughters attended Morningstar for a combined 3 years and I can't say enough about the teachers. My girls have learned so much in their care. My oldest has excelled in kindergarten this year and I have the amazing teachers at Morningstar to thank for that.

If you're looking for excellent childcare in a warm and caring environment, look no further. Hands down, the best childcare center around.

name: Crystal Evans
text:
From a dads point of view
I wanted a place that was safe, close to home and that would teach him. Our son is being cared for by teachers that truly care about him. I like the daily sheet that's sent home each day about his day. I appreciate that the teachers are actually teaching and not just watching him. KJ is
learning a lot at Morningstar and I feel that it will pay off when he starts grade school by attending Morningstar. We also have a daughter who's now in third grade who attended Morningstar and she's an "A" student... # school forAMAZINGKIDS

name: Abby Johnson
text: Morningstar is a wonderful daycare.  I have 1 boy that currently attends Morningstar and one who left 4k in August to start Kindergarten.  The staff does a great job at not only teaching the children, but making it FUN!  Because of the wonderful staff in 4K, my kindergartener is way ahead in his class and is currently reading on a 1st/2nd grade level. I would and have recommended Morningstar to anyone who is looking for not just a daycare, but a preschool for their child.

name: Mom of One
text: My little tike has been attending Morningstar for nine months. To say that he loves it is an understatement. Each morning he wakes up saying "go school" and is disappointment when it is not a school day. When he sees the building he starts singing "school, school, school, yeah!" He loves going to "school" and we love that!

name: Erica Jones
text:
I would absolutely recommend Morningstar Child Care to any parent!

I am a single, working mommy of three boys. My life is a whirlwind of church, work, sports, and - of course - the never-ending list of household tasks.  After unsuccessfully trying a few other centers, I was disheartened that I couldn't find a center that my youngest would love to attend...

Morningstar has hands-down become that center!!  Cason (who used to cry every morning for an hour at other centers) eagerly waits by the door at our house for ME to get ready to leave in the morning.  He LOVES his teacher AND his new friends.

I also ADORE the paintings and crafts that he brings home.  He has mastered his colors and enthusiastically talks the entire way home about the things that he has done that day!  I love Morningstar, and I feel confident that you will too!

name: Douglas Stevenson
text:
The employees at this daycare would rather try to sweep issues under the rug than deal with them. Our daughter was bitten by another child five times in the four months since moving into the infant D classroom. In early September it happened twice in one week, and that's when we finally decided to have a meeting with the office. We met with the assistant director Jonathan, and he tried to tell us that it is normal behavior and that none of the bites were aggressive. He also informed us that the daycare has no official policy when it comes to biting, other than simply informing the parents of all children involved that it happened, and perhaps additional meetings if it becomes an "issue". On Monday, October 2nd, our daughter was bitten again this time on the face. The teacher who was working the room that day informed my wife that the same boy who had bitten my daughter that day had also bitten two other children, and that it had been a consistent problem with this one child and the office and his parents knew about it but refused to take any real action. I had a meeting with the assistant director Jonathan the next morning, where he informed me that two of the bites were "not aggressive " because the children that were bitten we're trying to take a toy away. Later in the same conversation, he backtracked and claimed that there were not three bites in one day, and the information we were given was incorrect . Later that same day, my wife met with the director Brittany who informed her that there actually WERE three bites in one day, and that Jonathan knew about that and she's not sure why he would have told me that there weren't.
We understand that biting is an issue that is going to arise at most daycares, but we want to know that action will be taken when it becomes a clear and present problem. I also don't appreciate it when somebody looks me in the eye and lies to me. Parents trust daycares with the safety of their child, and they deserve to know what's going on.

resp.text: We sincerely regret that you and your family had a negative experience at School for Amazing Kids, Calera. As caretakers, we constantly strive to become more nurturing to children in our care and to better communicate with parents. Unfortunately, biting is common among babies and toddlers and we try our best to stay aware of when it happens and treat all children involved with the proper care. However, we always have room to improve. We appreciate your feedback and resolve to look into this matter more closely.

name: Liz Walker
text: When I asked my two-year-old this summer if he wanted to stay home and go to the pool with mommy or go to "school" (at Morningstar), he said, "school."  I think that explains it all!

name: Olivia Attical
text: This is the best child care facility in Calera, AL in my opinion my child has grown to love the kids and the staff. The facility is very clean and neat and actually looks like a school. The atmosphere is amazing they make you feel so welcome. They provide a very nutritious meals which includes breakfast, lunch and snack so you don't have to worry about providing any meals. Another important part about that is that it doesn't cost any extra just for the meal that is all included in the tuition. The curriculum that they are teaching I feel is awesome to help your child adjust to school. My two year old has learned so much in the past 5 weeks that I was amazed. All the hard work and dedication that those teachers put into their jobs really shows when you interact with your child on a daily basis.

name: Erica Arnold
text:
When I think about quality child care, one of the first things that come to mind is that I don’t want to have to sacrifice good care for my child(ren) at the sake of cost. And I was so happy when I realized that would not be the case at Morningstar! My children and I love the daycare employees, and I love that they get excellent care on a great budget.  Their prices are so reasonable, and this is the only daycare I have ever been in contact with that offers a military discount to families! That is AMAZING! But also with quality care, that is cost-reasonable, I worried about location. Morningstar’s location is great for parents who commute because it is right off the interstate. It is very easy to drop off my child and get right on the interstate to commute to work in the mornings.  And the facility is always How great that they support our troops in that way! As a military family, we couldn’t appreciate that more!

But also with quality care, that is cost-reasonable, I worried about location. Morningstar’s location is great for parents who commute because it is right off the interstate. It is very easy to drop off my child and get right on the interstate to commute to work in the mornings.  And the facility is always kept clean. The outdoor grounds are nice and there is a very nice playground for the children!

name: Kurt de klerck
text:
We were blessed to find school for amazing kids in calera when we moved to shelby county. Joshua has been attending sfak calera for almost 5 years !! now and still ,every day ,are we amazed about how much our son knows already for his age. he speaks very well, he behaves, he knows how to write and work with numbers already ! knows songs, days of the week etc... all this can only be achieved by staying busy with the kids . He likes to go to sfak calera, he does soccer, a guitar man comes over once a week to play songs, the have festivals and career days etc..
if you have the opportunity to have your child taken care off in a daycare, sfak calera is the best place to be !

name: Shirley Sanderson
text: Saw roaches and mice droppings in kitchen and the kids milk being left out too long

resp.text: Going back to December of 2016 we have scored no less than 99 on all health inspections. Our last inspection was conducted in June of 2017 in which we scored 100. If you have legitimate concerns about the cleanliness of our facilities we are happy to provide this documentation and speak with you in detail about this matter. Please call our main office at 205-620-1725.

name: Kelsey Sherbert
text: Great teachers who truly love the children they care for! Very clean and have had no problems

name: Lia Brady
text:
A little floored by my initial experience with this daycare. My daughter does not go here and I have heard wonderful things about this place. Unfortunately, that was not my experience.

When I walked in to have a "meet the teacher", the AD was grumpy and not very helpful. I ended up speaking to a teacher that was passing by. Looked at the classroom - wasn't what I was used to which is fine. It wasn't the worst, just not the organized, vibrant environment that I'm used to at her previous school. There is a lot that could be said about the aesthetics. When the director got there and I walked up to speak with her, she had a big smile and was very warm and welcoming. When I started asking questions about the program and mentioned that my daughter is currently at Heritage, she immediately crossed her arms and leaned back in a defensive stance. It was incredibly awkward trying to ask questions as an inquiring parent (which is normal when your child is starting a new school) because she seemed irritated that I was questioning anything. When I asked about curriculum for the class my daughter would've been enrolled in, she said verbatim, "The teacher hasn't been able to work much on that because some of our parents need better parenting skills and a lot of the kids weren't potty trained when they should've been, so the teacher had to work on that instead." Excuse me, what? Did you just bash the parents to a potential new parent at your school? Nonetheless, I thanked them for the information and left. Not once was I rude. I kept my composure during that entire (strange) ordeal.

I left a little perplexed and stunned and called my husband letting him know my experience. STILL, because I had heard such great things and wanted to give them a shot, I sent an email the next day letting them know we would like to start Monday. The director emailed back and asked me to call her, so I did. While on the phone, she basically told me she didn't want my negativity at the school (with a very chipper tone) and that she wanted her parents to be happy to bring their kids there. Again, 100% floored that she's saying this as I gave no indication that I was unhappy. I then tell her my experience when I met them and how she talked bad about other parents as my FIRST IMPRESSION. After that, she was silent on the phone for an awkward amount of time and finally said "I'm sorry you felt that way and you're right, we could've handled that better...but I don't think it will be a good fit. I've never said that, but sorry." And I just said okay thank you, have a good day and hung up.

I'm sure this is a great program (if you're okay with a 'play' daycare instead of one based on curriculum), but the way I was treated when I walked in is causing me to leave a bad review. I honestly can't tell you if I've ever left a bad review on anything before, but this was worth the write. I'm sure the kids are treated with love and respect, but the fact that she basically told me I couldn't enroll in her school had me dumbfounded. Still scratching my head wondering why I was treated this way after being so kind to them. Use your best judgement when enrolling! I don't know whether to make heads or tails of it.

name: Kelly Ratcliff
text: Absolutely ecstatic that I found this place!  My baby boy LOVES his teachers and I am VERY pleased that he has a smiling face every day I come in there.  Thank you Tena and all of the staff for taking him in and treating him as your own!

name: Jeremy Mcnelley
text:
Awesome place with amazing staff. They welcome me and my son as soon as we walk in. My son loves the people and and atmosphere there. He calls it "school" not daycare lol.
If you are interested in a daycare this one is definitely one to look into.

name: Arica Shetka
text: Beautiful kid friendly set up they have going on. Amazing staff. Quality toys and equipment

name: Bailey Godette
text: I am admittedly a very difficult parent to please; I expect the very best when it comes to my child. My child has learned more than I ever could have imagined at Vinehouse and we love her teachers and Ms. K so much that they feel like a part of our family. Her classroom is always immaculately clean and I never worry knowing she is genuinely loved while I'm gone. We are so in love with this school!!!!!!

resp.text: Mrs. Bailey! Thank you so much for giving us the opportunity to teach, love, and nature your beautiful child. You all are family to us and we love you all so much.

name: Maritza U
text:
Clean & presentable facility!
Friendly director/owner & staff!
Put all my feelings at ease knowing I picked the right daycare for my child! :)
Highly recommended!!

name: K O
text: The staff is all uniformed and nice. The director is well-versed with child development through education and experience. I toured the daycare on yesterday with my husband and two little ones--we loved it! My favorite room is the infant room but I loved all the room/age groups. The daycare is super clean, organized and neat. Many crunchy/natural mothers would love the daycare just as much as I did.

name: Hylesha Dill
text: The director and her team are all so amazing.

resp.text: Thank you so much Mrs. Hylesha! We adore your sweet family and we are so blessed to have you all here with us.

name: LaQueena Compere
text: Ms. K and her staff are exceptional! They don't  just watch your children, they invest in your children. They care for your children and they protect your children. This daycare is awesome and the teacher's truly love children! They have many programs that compliment the curriculum for the children. There is Soccer Shots, Zumbini, Mother goose who reads to the children and Spanish lessons. Vinehouse is growing and you truly will be blessed if your child is there.

name: Kelley Pesnell Conner
text: Wonderful place. They have an educational program, they are currently doing baby zumba. They do outdoor time when weather permits and they care for my child as if she was their own.

name: Stacy Serrano
text:
After being traumatized by the news and social media when it came to daycares it was really really hard to choose a affordable/trustworthy daycare! 🤔😥 it became a very stressful month when I found out I needed to look for a daycare because family babysitting wasn’t going to be an option anymore 😰😥😱 I toured about 4 different daycares, called several (which just talking to them over the phone was enough) to say this isn’t the place. Location, security, cleanliness, affordability and most importantly parents hunch about the daycares made me think is this the place I want to bring my baby 5 days a week?

That’s when I came across Vinehouse Nursery, thanks to a dear friend (Fransico). I was already thinking this is going to be like all the other places I’ve gone to before. But surprise surprise! 😱😱 As soon as you knock on the door the Director comes to greet you with a huge smile on her face. She answers any questions you may have and offers to give you a tour at that moment (if you have time).

She took me through the WHOLE building, (bathrooms/break rooms/kitchen/I mean every room the nursery has. At that moment my heart felt a HUGE relief! Everyone is super friendly/bubbly, cleanness is remarkable, security, organization and ITS AFFORDABLE! My mom sensors were yelling YES! YES! YES! THIS IS PERFECT! Just what I was looking for!

name: Caitlin
text: I was very hesitant to put my kids in daycare after spending most of their lives with a private caregiver. My younger sister went to Angie’s when she was younger and loved it. Due to a last minute crisis, my kids had to start daycare within 3 business days. Angie graciously took both of them in. Now 7 months later they both love going to daycare. Angie remembers all of her kids, no matter how long it’s been since she’s seen them. The teachers there also learn each child’s habits. They know my son always runs to Ms. Angie every morning and loves playing in the big kid room. They know my daughter has to give everyone a hug and kiss before she leaves for the day. 10000% the best place I could’ve picked.

name: Chealsee Porchowsky
text: Please don’t send your kids there.

name: Amanda Chaney
text: My 3 yr old daughter absolutely loves it. They are really good with all the kids and Mrs.Angie has a heart of gold and treats all of the kids like her own. She has learned so much just after a month of being there and is excited every morning to get up and go.

name: Jessica Gemnell
text: They are so sweet and good with the kids. My son loves it. The pre-k class does a good job working with them and teaching them my son knew how to spell his name after just a day or two after going.

name: Paisley Flannagin
text: i hate this place they were so rude to me while i was there they are mean please don't let your kids go there

name: Nise 2You
text: Statements made by the receptionist who facilitated the tour, we're insulting and personally hurtful. Her visual observations should be kept to herself and shared with the staff as need to knows for the betterment of my child versus choosing to use an open forum of the admitting office in front of others. Not to mention her observation is not valued or wanted, seeing that she does not hold not one certification in childcare development.

name: Rayuna
text: Great place to take kids as an after school care.

name: 123 Powell
text:
We love sending our 4 month old son to Heritage Preschool. Being a first time mom with a newborn, my husband and I searched diligently to find the best fit for us and our family. After visiting several daycares, we knew immediately after we visited that Heritage was perfect for us.
We always have an amazing experience with everyone we ever encounter in all departments.
So I believe their staff all share the same vision.
I am confident and at ease when I drop my son off, because I truly believe he is loved and well taken care of... what more could a mom want.

name: Ali Wesson
text: My two babies who are now 2 and 4 have been at Heritage since the infant room. They are the only facility we would ever consider. The staff is amazing, the facility is top notch. Not to mention the curriculum. I would recommend them to anyone I know. Thank you Heritage for taking such great care of my babies!

name: Amy Barnett
text:
Heritage

We started our journey with Heritage amongst a pandemic. Around us the world lived in fear of getting sick and hid behind masks and shelter in place orders. As we started to venture out we knew we needed to put our daughter in a place that was welcoming, caring, God fearing, and safe. When we walk through the doors at Heritage there is no way to not feel this comfort. We are greeted each morning by the office staff with warm hello’s in a clean and welcoming atmosphere. As you transition throughout the building it is impossible to not feel welcome and see how safe and cared for the children are. The entire staff always goes out of their way to help and ensure your child is getting the utmost care. If you are on the fence about a day care let me help you make the decision. Heritage of Pelham is hands down the best daycare in our area. We are blessed to have them help us raise both of our girls.

name: Samantha P
text: Heritage Pelham is the best!!! All the teachers we’ve had have all been truly precious people and always taken great care of our little one!! They love the kiddos so much and make each one feel special. I’m so grateful for all they do and that we are apart of the Heritage family. I always recommend them and tell everyone how happy we are with them!

name: Kate Waudby
text: This is the best preschool around town! Every staff member is so kind and welcoming. The second time I ever walked through the door with my baby, they knew him by name. The rooms are very well taken care of and exceptionally clean. I would definitely recommend it to anyone and everyone looking for a preschool for their child.

name: Jessica Porterfield
text: We moved our son (3 yo) to Heritage from a different local daycare a year ago, and are so happy with our decision. We have been so impressed with the love they show him every day, and the education that he receives. I can trust that he is in good hands for the 9+ hrs that I am away from him at work. Heritage is a great school with great office staff and teachers!

name: Alison Howell Steineker
text: We love Heritage Preschool.  It has been a great experience for our two year old.  The management and teachers are top notch.  The facility is beautiful and our little girl loves it there. I would highly recommend to other parents.

name: Christina Dennis
text: We went through a few preschools until we found Heritage. Our little girl was adopted, and the other schools we tried were not willing to work with us on our daughter's needs as she became adjusted to a new culture. We finally tried Heritage Preschool of Pelham, and were blown away. The staff is amazing, and assured us that they would work with our child as she became accustomed to a new culture, new school, and any past traumas she had dealt with. They have done just that! Our daughter now wakes up excited to go to "school" and jumps out of bed. She immediately talks about her friends, her teachers, and runs in the door with excitement upon arrival. We can also tell that Heritage puts a ton of effort into teaching our little one, as her speech has highly improved. She's learning so much, and we couldn't be more grateful for the staff at Heritage! Thank you for giving us the confidence to leave our girl in your hands, and for showing her that she is in a safe place to be free to learn and discover new things! We couldn't ask for any better!

name: Katie Haggard
text: I have such a piece of mind dropping my kids off everyday knowing they are learning, socializing, and having fun. The best part is I know they are being well taken care of and I do not have to worry! I would 100% recommend this school.

name: Peyton Penfield
text: We are so excited to have joined the Heritage family. We had a difficult time with our 2 y/o daughter at her last school and spent a lot of time trying to figure out if it was just the terrible two’s or if she just wasn’t getting enough out of the school. We started to seek out other schools and looked at a few in the area and our heart gravitated towards Heritage. I believe God led us to these wonderful people and since joining our girl has gone 180 from where she was. She is engaged all day, is happier when she comes home, her mood is fun and spunky, her language is exploding and the teachers there truly love and care for her. From the moment you walk in you are greeted with joy from everyone. I have much thanks and am so grateful for the amazing staff at Heritage and look forward to watching our girl grow with them.

name: Josh Buchanan
text: Larry Vann needs to go. Also, they'll occasionally give away a months tuition for a five star review so I'm curious how many of these "reviews" are legitimate.

name: Shannon Davis White
text: Heritage is such a great place. It’s more than a daycare/preschool they are a part of our family helping to mold and shape our kids. The best choice you can make is enrolling your children here.

name: Oreal Hixon
text: My son has attended this school since he was 6 months old and now he is in kindergarten.  He has learned so much and received great care. The teachers and front staff are just like family.

name: April Hubbard
text: Heritage Preschools is a wonderful place to send your children! 2 of my children have gone through the whole program from 6 weeks to 6 years and my 6 month old is currently attending. The quality of care they give the children is so high. We have made some really good friends there that we still talk to even though they aged out of Heritage. My oldest 2 were academically ready for school when they left Heritage. The staff is so loving and they care about the children and their families. I highly recommend Heritage Preschools for your little ones!

name: Miranda McClanahan
text: When we started looking for childcare for our baby boy, Heritage easily made it on our list of places to look into. And then, they blew us away and easily became the very clear choice for us! After years of investigating abuse and neglect (including daycare settings), I have extremely high expectations when it comes to childcare. I was not going to send my child just anywhere. I am also super strict when it comes to safe sleep practices. Like many parents, the thought of leaving my child with someone else gave me a lot of anxiety to say the least. However, I have had so much peace knowing my child is cared for by the very best! I do not have to worry about his safety, and his teachers have proven time and time again how much they care for him and love their jobs. My son has been in the Infant II class with Charla, Suzy, and Mykah. I already know how hard it’s going to be when he’s ready to move up to the next class because these teachers are so wonderful! He has learned and developed so much. He loves going to see his teachers and friends each day! They keep me updated on him, and they love sharing about his day!

name: Ashley Murry
text: The Heritage is always spotless and the teachers are always very pleasant. My daughter has attended The Heritage Preschool of Pelham since she was 5 months and she is now 3 and still loves it to this day .  Every morning when I drop her off she greets her teachers and classmates with a smile, which makes it a lot easier to feel comfortable going to work.  I feel this way because the Director and Teachers are more like family than anything else .

name: Rachel Seaborn
text: I highly recommend Heritage Preschools. We’ve had a great experience. It’s exceptionally clean and well kept. The teachers and staff are supportive, friendly and take great care of the children. We transferred our daughter from another daycare and their structure, curriculum, and atmosphere has been wonderful! We're thankful for their Christ-centered curriculum and hearts for the kids there. It really shows. Our daughter has just blossomed and learning so much at Heritage!

name: Beth Simpson
text:
Words can't describe the LOVE we feel at Heritage! Our two girls are loved so much and have learned so much from their teachers! I never worry about the safety of our children while at work because I know they are in the best of care. They truly love the kids like they are their own!!
And when your child comes home and tells you she can do all things through God you know you are sending her to the right place!

name: Lori Cannady
text: My 2 sons go to heritage in Pelham and I cannot think of anything negative to say about this place. They are so kind and always make sure we’re happy. The teachers are so caring and love on my babies like their own! The admin go above and beyond to help with anything we need. Through thick and thin, this school has always put us first! And the building is beautiful! Highly recommend this location.

name: David and Katy Bush
text: We have had a wonderful experience! Our boys are well loved and encouraged to be their best. I love that Ms Doris keeps me in the loop when my son has a tough day so we can help him when he's struggling. I feel like it's a team effort. The admin staff is so welcoming and Larkin is wonderful. I cant speak highly enough of the experience we have had so far!

name: John Haggard
text:
We have had a great experience with Heritage. Our son used to ask not to have to go to school but now that he’s at Heritage he gets excited for school in the morning. He thrives under the structure, discipline,
and guidance of his teachers. His teachers really care about him and truly want what’s best for him.

name: Gina Borgosz
text: I have nothing but great things to say about my experience at Heritage! We’ve been there for a year and I feel that my daughter has grown and learned so much, she loves to be around people, and is so loved by her sweet teachers! The administration and office staff are very friendly and keep me informed weekly. This was the first daycare we toured, and we looked at two others after, but nothing compared to Heritage! Highly recommend!

name: Mary Gray
text: We LOVE Heritage!  The facility is clean and beautiful, their infant care is amazing, and their curriculum will give your little ones a strong foundation for their early learning years.  They are far more than just a daycare and truly care about the WHOLE family!

name: M. Crocker
text: Amazing staff! The teachers genuinely care for their students and the admin team goes above and beyond every day, not just for the students but for the parents and the staff as well. The curriculum is far more than I expected, they actually teach the students how to read so they are more than prepared for elementary school.  Highly recommend!!

name: Lia Brady
text: Great management and teachers - all of the Heritage locations far exceed any expectation you could ever have about a preschool. I would honestly never take my child anywhere else. Once you have the best, it's hard to go anywhere else!

name: Colby Nicholson
text: Fantastic Preschool! Our daughter has been going here for a little over a year now. The teachers and staff are very friendly and take exceptional care of the kids. You can tell that they really care. The facility is always very clean which is a BIG deal to us and I am sure very hard to do with so many children. The Godly manner in which they teach the kids and run the preschool is unmatched and very hard to find anywhere else. Our daughter sang the "God Our Father" prayer song that they sing everyday before having a tea party with her toys the other day and it melted our hearts. That is the kind of stuff that you want your kids learning from the people that they spend the majority of time with. We love Heritage!

name: Lakenya Wilson
text: There is no where I would rather my children attend. We have some of the best teachers, and they are all CPR certified (A PLUS) . The management is phenomenal! The facility is spotless, and safe. We love Heritage!!!

name: Ali Wesson
text: My children have been with them since they were infants. We love the school and the staff. The teachers truly care about their students and it shows. They have a great facility and an excellent curriculum.

name: Chibi Maruko
text: Both of my kids like the Heritage preschool. We moved our kids from another daycare and it was a big decision to make for us. Now, we are glad we made that decision. Our oldest son is learning so much stuff from school and I can easily see that because he tells me what he did at school everyday. Sometimes, he even gives me a little lecture using his small white board how to write letters and numbers (his name, his brother's name, blends...etc). Our young one shows a big smile and looks so happy when he sees his teacher every morning which makes me happy and feel so relief as well.  And I have to mention that the facility is really clean.

name: Jessica Howland
text: Our two children have been at Heritage for the past year and a half. We moved them there from another center, and we are so glad that we did. They love it there. They have had great teachers, and they have both learned so much. It is such a relief to trust the people who take care of your children and not have to worry about them all day. We can’t recommend Heritage enough!

name: Melody Jordan
text: My son (2.5) attended a home daycare and didn’t start until he was 4 months old. I was a little hesitant about our daughter starting at a “real” daycare at 8 weeks old.  Ms. Rachel and Ms. Kim are amazing with  her and you can really tell that she LOVES being there. They go above and beyond to make sure she is happy and well cared for. I could not be any happier with our experience at Heritage in Pelham. Everyone from the front office to the directors to the teachers go out of their way to help, pray and make your child feel welcomed and loved!

name: amanda moore
text: Hands down the BEST preschool around! Every teacher has been so kind and truly invested themselves into my daughter.. I will always recommend Heritage Preschool!

name: Erin Sullivan
text: As a first time mom I had severe doubts/concerns/fears about sending my new baby somewhere ... until we started here at Heritage. The staff is welcoming and learns everyone’s names, the place is spotless, and they genuinely care for the kids. My son is in the infant 1 classroom and his teachers have become a huge part of our lives helping us with milestones/advice/showing he can do things or play with things - before we even knew he could - helping him learn and grow. It is worth every penny having peace of mind he’s being loved on and cared for each day.

name: Rachel Etheridge
text: I have thoroughly enjoyed my time at Heritage. There is such a great atmosphere and it is a great place to work. We aim to spread the love of Christ to every family that walks through our doors.

name: WTGardner
text: One of the best places to have your young children learn and socialize as they grow.  We love having both of our girls there!

name: Coley Robichaux
text: Heritage has been a blessing to my family! I was very apprehensive about sending my child to school since my oldest child hasn’t done preschool. Heritage calmed my nerves by showing so much love and attention to my child. I thought morning drop offs would be difficult but seeing my child light up when she sees her teacher makes me so happy! Getting daily updates and pictures puts my mind to ease as well. No matter how many people are coming and going in the front lobby, my child is always acknowledged by name from any employee to start and end our day. ❤️

name: Jordan Uptagrafft
text: We love Heritage Preschool! My kids are so excited to run down the hallways and greet their teachers and friends each morning. The teachers are so hands on and loving! My kids have learned so much and not just about their ABCs and shapes but also that they have a Savior that loves them so much. They are taught the ten commandments and are challenged to memorize bible verses! Heritage is family and we love it so much!

name: Natalya Winters
text: Reviews are so important. Actually, my husband does not purchase items or visit locations without reading the reviews! My 4yr old started in September 2019 and it has been such a wonderful experience. For our family [like many], it's important that our daughter is in an environment that uplifts her. Pre-K is such an important time is a child's educational and social transition. Our sweet girl has a syndrome and has been teased at another school; It left me feeling hopeless about what was to come [starting kindergarten], but she has not come home with any stories about being teased since starting at Heritage. I attribute that to the welcoming environment that you are greeted with from the front door to the classroom and everything space in between. They have listened to and explored every concern my husband and I have had. They keep us updated weekly on events and news, which is important for me as a working mom. (I'd hate for her to miss out on PJ day because no one informed me) It is a great school with great staff who love patiently on all the children. We thank God for this experience as we prepare for Kindergarten!

name: Charla Jex
text: I love this school, it has brought me great joy and happiness for many years. Heritage is the best daycare for your precious children.

name: Natalie Jenkins (NatBug)
text: This is a really good daycare. My little one loves it here! The teachers are amazing and treat everyone like family💜 and you can tell they love their students as if they were their child. Best decision when choosing a daycare!

name: Rochelle Newby
text: Best daycare ever! I was terrified when I thought about leaving my 8 week-old in the arms of a stranger, but the moment I toured the school, I was sold. I was not impressed with the other daycares that I visited because they were either lacking in cleanliness, preparedness, or security and Heritage Preschool of Pelham was on point with everything. Miss Rachel and Miss Kim were the best!!!! Aniyah is no longer with them but she still loves to stop by their room just to say hello.  My precious baby is now 16 month-old and I still have no regrets. She loves every one of her teachers from Miss Anna and Miss Netty (who used to be in 2B) to Miss Ashley (in 3B). I have yet to meet a teacher that I have issues with, and management has been nothing short of amazing. Heritage is like an extension of our home and I am at peace at work each day because I know she is safe and surrounded by love.

name: Tanna Roberts
text: High quality care that implements a curriculum that promotes social, emotional, physical, language, and cognitive learning and development. Positive relationships are promoted & families are encouraged to participate in their child’s learning.

name: Amanda Nicholls
text: We love heritage. I moved my kids a little over a year ago to heritage. It is an amazing school. My kids have grown soo much. My son had his first seizure at heritage and they were on the ball when responding to his needs. The office staff and teachers are amazing. They have truly became family,. The Director Larkin has literally been a a gift from God to my family. He has helped me through a lot of things. If you are looking for an amazing family for you kids to become close with this is it.

name: Lindsay Smith
text: Heritage Preschool is a great school and daycare. My oldest son has been going to this daycare for over 3 years now and I also have an 8 month old son who attends the daycare as well. The teachers are friendly and provide your children with a great education. My 3 year old has learned so much from the teachers at Heritage and he amazes me every day with something new that he has learned. They also love on your children and treat them like they are their own. I never worry about my children when I leave them because I know they are in great hands. The office staff is very friendly and do a great job to ensure that parents are happy. Whenever I have had questions or concerns, they have always been willing to sit down with me to discuss those concerns and to figure out a solution to the problem or discuss ways to make things better. My 3 year old son also loves Bible Study and learning about Jesus with Mr. Larkin, the director.

name: Regina Gentry
text:
Its so sad to say that the school leadership has changed since the split of CCS. I believe in the vision of the owner but don't feel that the vision is being led correctly. I was told that my precious rainbow baby and my kindergartener could no longer attend the school because I mentioned a competitors school to a teacher. (my job has changed and I was looking elsewhere for care) what kind of company immediately kicks out precious children (my 5 year old and a 1 year old) because a competitor was mentioned? There was no animosity, mal intent or anything! It was mentioned in passing. Then I get a call out of no where saying their stuff has been packed up and I can pick it up the next day and it was because I mentioned Ardent to a teacher.
This is not a daycare that is about the well-being of the children anymore. They just kicked my babies out! They could care less about what is to happen to my children or where they are to go. My children are good children! They dont deserve to be left high and dry from the one place we prayed over and trusted to care for them!

My beautiful rainbow sustained chemical burns just two weeks ago from the cleaner they use. Did I up and pull them? No, because I still had faith in them. Then just two weeks later they are kicked out. I just dont understand. Are they so scared of the competition that just mentioning it they will make your kids leave? I dont know but one thing I do know is Mia and Skylar DO NOT DESERVE to be kicked out of the one place that was entrusted   with their care.

name: Katherine Cardwell
text: Heritage preschool is a wonderfully well rounded, loving, Christ centered environment for little ones! I wouldn't want to send my child anywhere else.

name: Paul Vest
text: Very thankful for the caring and attentive staff at Pelham!

name: Lacey Aman
text:
I am so thankful for CCS! My twins have attended for a little over 3 years and my 5 MO since she was 8 weeks. I decided to change daycares for several reasons and regretted it the entire week. Yes, O N E week and I had to move the girls back. CCS Pelham is our ‘home’ and we are happy to be back!
The curriculum is awesome and the daily teaching of the Bible is amazing! The girls have learned so much thanks to the staff and we look forward to many more years!

name: kelly
text: We love Heritage!

name: Rian Mitchell
text: I absolutely love this school. The teachers are so friendly and they genuinely care for the kids. I can tell that my child is learning so much here and he’s really coming out of his shell because his teachers make him comfortable. It’s a great place and I highly recommend it!

name: Amber Roberts
text: When I first started working here I absolutely fell in love. However, coworkers did warn me about the management and I didn’t listen. I recently found out I was pregnant and I tell them and they treat me differently. They  did not want to work with me when it came to doctors appointments, they told me I wasn’t giving “ a 110%” to my room, because I had to walk out a few times to get sick ( pregnant so I couldn’t help it). I love my kiddos and still came and pushed through it for my kids and that didn’t matter at all. I’ve had some complications with my pregnancy, but of course that didn’t matter to them. So many coworkers bad mouth the management, but we stay for the kids. I do not recommend working here they go through A LOT of employees. Also, if a kid got sick and parents needed to be called the office wouldn't call  we would bring the kids to the office more than once and sometimes still no call. The parents would pick up at the end of the day and be frustrated that they never received even a message from the office.  However, the parents and kids are amazing 💗

name: Kayla Hyman
text: Best place my daughter has ever been. We love her teachers!

name: Ashley Hendricks
text: My child was bitten and we were not notified! I didn’t find out that she was bitten until I was giving her bath that evening and notice a large bite mark on her shoulder! My husband and I were confused because when he picked her up that day he asked her teacher if anything happened today and if she had a good day and her teacher lied and said that nothing happened and that my daughter had a good day. The next day my husband and I were livid sand when he brought her to school he asked the teacher directly was our daughter bitten and pulled down her sleeve to reveal the bite marks and only then did the teacher admit that she was bitten but didn’t explain the scenario for how she was bitten. She didn’t even apologize for not telling us! She only just said that she saw the incident but didn’t think it broke the skin! That tells me that she didn’t even look or apply aid to my child! My husband asked if our daughter cried and she said yes but didn’t say that she comforted my daughter at all. I was at work when my husband called to tell me all this. I called and talked w/ the manager and all she did was cover up for her worker. She admitted that this was not the first time that this employee had not followed standard protocol as no report was written and turned in at all on the day of the incident but she kept saying” I know her heart” screw that my child was injured and I was not notified! Just unacceptable! The manager admitted that no medical aid had been applied to my child! When asked how all this happened she said my daughter was playing with a toy first and a child wanted it and when the child couldn’t get it he bite my daughter. She said my daughter did nothing wrong. Reluctantly we had to leave her there for the day as my husband had to go to work and we have no family or friends available to watch her. When my picked her up today he was handed a report about the incident and on the document the director lied saying that the bite was wiped and cold pack was applied and this  never occurred! She told me earlier today that the teacher stated that she didn’t think the skin broke and she agreed that she had not assessed the bite to see if skin was in fact broken! She didn’t give a flip about my child! So she falsified documents to cover up for her incompetent, lazy employee! She admitted to my husband that this was not the first time that this employee had done something like this and yet she keeps her as an employee!This is not a place to bring your children! They will not take care of your child and will NOT report to you if anything bad happened to your child throughout the course of the day! We will be removing our child as soon as we find another daycare! I’m beyond livid w/ the facility!

name: Satish Parvataneni
text:
We sent our kiddo here when she was 15 month old and our experience with Odyssey is exceptional.

It is very well run daycare/learning center and teachers are organized, affectionate towards the children. Always makes the child welcome. After the initial jitters and rash of ear infections and fevers my daughter adjusted and then thoroughly enjoyed going here.

Most important thing is place is super clean and all the teachers we have had experience with are genuinely caring and affectionate towards our kiddo and communicative towards parents. Especially last 2 years (k3 and k4) were a blast. From the administration point of view, they are not defensive and open to dialogue and suggestions from parents.

One of the times, we were struck at the center for overnight due to a snow situation in Birmingham. The way teachers and the director Ms Annie handled the situation was superb. I almost feel lucky to have discovered this center.

I have to mention especially about the assistant director Miss Jennifer. I don't know how she remembers all the children by their names etc. :) she would always greet kids with their name and a big smile. Other than running the operations smoothly, she is understanding and supportive of all the situations that parents go through as we deal with job transfers etc. can't thank her for enough.

I highly recommend this place.

name: Jennifer M. Williams
text: I believe that there are not enough reviews on here to judge such and impeccable learning facility! Therefore, I am adding mine to show future families of Odyssey how wonderful this school is! First, My child has been attending Odyssey since 6 weeks old. We have had an amazing experience since! Annie and Jennifer have always done everything in their power to please any wishes I had for childcare (and I am a hard mom to please) Yes, Annie is straight forward and awesome, but I am also a huge fan of Jennifer’s ability to make anything happen if it deems possible. Sometimes this may seem as though she is not “to the point,”, when in fact, she may be changing the point all together to fit my needs! She has loving and understanding customer service and I have never had any issues that I Couldn’t come to her about. When my child has moved up in rooms, we have had teacher changes. Especially on the toddler hall. I have never been disappointed with any teacher that my son has had though. They send home a letter upon a teachers leaving and let us know who our new teacher will be. This happens, bc unfortunately a preschool teacher isn’t always a main career for a young adult. However, in the infant hall/preschool hall their teacher have been at Odyssey 10-20 years!!! Now that truly says something about the owner and directors! You have to be doing good by your employees if they work for you each day for decades!
