So, when my child’s teacher is replaced I figure that it is either due to a career path change or that they didn’t meet Odyssey standards and I am just Fine with that! Lastly, I am so appalled that the previous review referred to the floaters as “randoms” This has to be the most offensive sentence I have read in all of these reviews. The floaters work just as hard as the named teachers at Odyssey...some work harder! I bet every one of them knows every child by name. Watch the cameras yourself! I watch the floaters clean up meals, place out cots/high chairs, put up cots and chairs, close down rooms when they haven’t been in there all day, put my child to sleep, rock my baby when the teachers are busy feeding. I have never seen a group of more loving floaters. I have used one of the floaters as a babysitter and felt from the beginning that she loved my son Just as much as I do! Most of the time floaters are there because they have 2nd jobs and work at Odyssey part time. I also know that a few of them are full time employees and would rather help out and love on all the children than be placed in one room. I wish you would have thought about that sentence before you posted, because if you have never had your child physically harmed by a teacher at Odyssey, then why scare people into thinking that a floater may? They have the same couple of floaters every day and my child can name all of them. It is my hope that all the floaters get just as much recognition as the teachers at Odyssey bc they do the same thing and that is providing a safe, clean, and  professional child care facility where I know my child is loved. Now that my child is getting ready to go into kindergarten soon, I am beyond please with his knowledge! He can almost read! He can write! He can do things that first graders are doing in elementary schools! I owe this all to Odyssey and their outstanding curriculum. Thank you for providing us a second family and I will always refer family and friends to Odyssey!

name: Amy Brunson
text: I cannot day enough good things about Odyseey Inverness. The teachers have become like family tomus and both of my children have flourished there. We would never consider sending them anywhere else!

name: Tanga Lawler
text: She Happy we Happy

name: vannisha Howard

He is soo happy over there. He love his teacher.

text: My son has been at Kindercare for a year now and we absolutely love it. He has grown and learned so much in the last year and it's amazing to see his development. We transferred from a church daycare, and while he did receive excellent care there, being at a preschool that emphasizes skills and knowledge while still strongly encouraging play has been lifechanging. I could never go back to a daycare program after being part of Kindercare.

name: April Theobald
text: We have been so extremely happy with the care our kiddos have received at Kindercare!  We have been at the center for almost 2 years and over that time have found all of the staff to be very professional, loving and they treat the kids like their own. We have two boys at the center (6 years and 2 1/2 years) and everyone knows their names, even the caregivers in other rooms. We really like that the boys can see each other throughout the day even though they are in separate rooms. We were also very happy with the structure In the PreK Room and found that it was very helpful in preparing our son for Kindergarden. I would highly recommend Kindercare!

name: Amy Sills
text: We've been extremely happy with the Pre-K program my 4 year-old attends.  Her teacher, Ms. Christine, is amazing.  The class is well-run, and my 4 year-old has learned so much already - academic skills, as well as social/emotional skills.  The directors, Courtney and Audrey, are always friendly and have been very accommodating.  At the beginning of the year, they put on an a very informative parent night where we met with the Pre-K teacher and were given expectations about what the year would look like, what the day would look like, and what we can do at home to help our kids grow.  They put on school-wide events like "Back to School Night",  and a "Fall Festival", and I'm sure more as the year goes on.  The center is very accommodating to working parents.  The Pre-K program is a great balance of academics, social/emotional skills, and fun!  They do special days like "teddy bear workshops", "pumpkin patch" and class parties.  If you're looking for a pre-school for your child, I highly recommend KinderCare!

name: Lauren D
text: We enrolled our son in sugar and spice at 5 months of age after being denied by 3 other daycares (closer to us and WAY MORE expensive) due to COVID19 making most places "half capacity." Well, we couldn't have been more blessed. The staff at sugar and spice are incredibly nurturing and caring. They absolutely love the kids. I never doubted my son wasn't taken care of. We are incredibly grateful to have found sugar and spice and are thankful to Sybil, owner, for running such an amazing establishment at an affordable price. Thank you for my son's happiness, all the beautiful hand made crafts we got to bring home, and all the friends we made. We are only leaving due to another job opportunity out of state. We highly recommend this place. We will miss you all!

text: Hands down an excellent place. They have been so reliable. The children seem very happy. Big playground and frequent recess. They have great success prepping the children for school, and they obviously care about the children and families.

name: Karen R
text: Lots of reviews by people who are emotional and not critical thinkers, and have never even been to S&S, but feel entitled to post negative comments based off a FB post (and even then, they are making all sorts of other assumptions as well). I've had kids attending since 2014 and every one of them has loved it and loved their teachers.

name: Paola Myers
text:
Statement from my sister in law: On February 26, 2018, I was relieved to be off work and on my way to pick up my children. I walked up to the daycare office and my children burst out of the door to greet me. Hellos, hugs and kisses were shared. I shuffled them to the car as usual, trying to hurry home. I asked them how their days were and the news I would receive from my children would change my outlook on the world. My son, who is 5, stated he had good news and sad news. (This is a usual statement. He like to say something sad and good that happened during his day. He said his teacher pushed him down. Taken aback, I inquired what happened? I had thought for sure I misunderstood. He repeated himself in more detail that she had taken her hand to the back of his head and pushed him off of the picnic table. He continued that he had fallen on the rocks of the playground and hurt his hands and knees. I checked his hands and knees, but there were minor indications of trauma. The owner of the daycare assured me she would get to the bottom of it and let me know. She expressed how much she loves my children and cares for us like family. Trying to reassure myself, I say how maybe he was mistaken, because his sister had said stuff before and recanted. Surely, I told myself, there has to be some mistake. My children have attended this daycare for over 4 years, and we have not had major incidents in that time.....Boy, was I wrong....
The owner of the daycare gave me her phone the next night, so I could feel better about the situation and know that my children are safe. She stated how my son was mistaken and that the teacher had caught him from falling, etc.. I was left to watch the video in slow motion to find out what happened....Shocking!  I took my children out of this place immediately. The teacher pushed down my son and I have it on video. I advice you to stay away from this place!

name: Taneshia Pendleton
text: I don't even know where to begin. My child attended this place for less than a month. The teachers clearly are not trained. On several instances I walked into the building and heard teachers yelling at kids. No positive reinforcement at all only negative. I don't yell at my child and don't expect a teacher to either. Next, there was a security concern. No formal system of regulations to keep intruders out. Plus, on instances I have walked into a classroom to see the teacher's boyfriend I presume just hanging out. That was the Big oh no for me. Then I have seen the teacher's send 2 year old girls into the bathroom together, no supervision and some of the girls were pushing and hitting others, which is the same thing I witnessed during nap time. Not sure why they let kids be on someone else's sleep mat either. For a place that claims to be "more than a babysitting service" they get a F from me. My babysitter are more qualified then these people.

text: Just tried to talki g to them about my children and once she told me she had no room i went to ask if they had a waiting list and before i could say anything she hung up on me. That is honestly so rude and unprofessional. If i could give less than a 1 star i would.

resp.text: Ms. Karrin i am so sorry this happened! I am sure that whomever you spoke to did not mean to hang up on you. If you would like to call back and speak to our assistant director I'd love to assist you however I can.

name: Juan Torres
text: Horrible experience. My wife and I went in a week in advance and was told there was an available spot for our daughter. We signed up that day. Fast forward to next week our first day to drop our daughter off. They didn’t have any room available and were over booked. they failed in notifying us that there wasn’t any room available. This business should not be taken seriously.

resp.text:
Hello Mr. Torres,
First I would like to apologize in our failure to notify you that the last spot available had been taken. We run on a first come first serve basis. When your wife called last thursday, and then stopped by her second tour she was told that she didn't seem very comfortable with leaving your child in our center. Our first priority is always the children and then the  parents. If you do not feel comfortable when taking a tour and after meeting the staff then this is probably not the center for you. Your wife was told that we would hold all her information and if she went home and decided this was the place for her to come back so I believe there was a communication error in that part. We take great pride in the love and care we give each and every student here. I am very sorry you did not have a good experience and wish you both luck in finding the center that will better fit your needs!

name: Katie Henry
text: I had intended to sign my son up for the summer and had been speaking to someone on their Facebook page. When I arrived, not only did no one know what I was talking about, I was told they didn’t know what they were doing for the summer and they’d take my name & number and call me. On my way out I drove past their “playground” their fence was missing several boards, so you could see right in to the dirt pit with a jungle gym, 2 teachers sitting at a picnic table talking while kids ran around screaming. I was glad at that point that I didn’t send him there.

resp.text: I apologize Ms. Henry for the miscommunication. We have two owners and an assistant director who all run our facebook page. We did have some fence boards missing and were not using that playground at that time. All fencing has since been fixed!  We are currently completing building renovations as well as updating our playgrounds. Again I apologize for the miscommunication and thank you for your consideration.

name: Tatum Butterfield
text: I want to say thank you to the staff and management of Childcare Network who go above and beyond on a daily basis to make sure that my child’s needs are met. Lisa, Stepheni, and Tway insure that safety is a priority at Childcare Network. The teachers take their jobs as care givers to the children of our community very serious.  Every teacher my child has had (from infant room to the two year old room) has treated her like family. Childcare Network puts mind at rest and I find comfort in knowing that my child is safe and loved while I’m at work. Again, thank you for all you do.

resp.text: Hi Tatum, thank you for taking the time to leave us a positive review! We work hard to meet expectations like yours, and we are happy that you are satisfied with the care and education our teachers provide your child. Thank you for choosing Childcare Network, we are so thankful to have you and your family a part of our Childcare Network family.

name: Audrey Johnson
text: I’m going to start by saying the staff that works directly with the children are great! However the management such as corporate is awful! Not ms. Tway or Stephanie. I get childcare subsidy obviously because I can’t afford childcare on my own! They told me Friday that I have to pay childcare out of pocket because child care subsidy only pay it once a year! If childcare charges once a year then why would you guys charge twice a year? That is not a working moms best friend! That is a inconvenience and makes it impossible to go to work. So I’ll probably be missing a week of work because the company wants to make more money any way they see fit! Strongly recommend the staff definitely do not support the corporation rules as a whole! Lisa butler is rude and don’t care about people much like Donald trump a total tyrant!

resp.text: We appologize for the inconvenience. We are available to speak with you about any concerns you might have. Please call 833-407-6174 to speak to Corporate Customer Care to discuss this matter further.

text: So... first off I want to clarify the "discount for review" thing everyone is talking about. text: I called to see if there were openings for both of my children's ages, I was put on hold for 5 minutes to be told unfortunately there was a wait list for both of their age groups. I asked to be able to put my kids on the wait list. The first lady acted like she was annoyed that I asked. And put me on hold for another 5 minutes, and was transferred to the lady that handles the wait list. Of the 30inute phone call less than 5 minutes of the call was spent actually talking. I understand there is probably a high volume of calls, but even being put on a wait list I'm still a potential client/customer. Either one of those people could have taken their information down and just put them on the wait list.

resp.text: Hello Brittany, we apologize for the inconvenience this has caused you. However, after checking with the director, it looks like we do have some space available. If you would give us a call back, at 334-214-5273 and select option two and then press 1 to be transferred directly to the school. We will be happy to help get your little one enrolled!

You may have to re-evaluate how you determine good childcare.   If your child runs to their teacher, and all the other teachers know her name as she is leaving..... that is the sign of good childcare.

The school age program is very good as well.  The facililty's school age room is also very updated and very age appropriate.

name: Adam Owens
text: My son has been going to this daycare for over 2 and a half years and we love it. I have always enjoyed spending time with my son so it is not uncommon for me to him off in the morning and stay for 20 minutes or longer to hang out with him and his friends in his class.  The teachers have always been appreciative of me spending time with him and when he was younger, I would stop by at random times without warning just to check on him, to see him and was always greeted and got a chance to know his teachers. I have appreciated the curriculum because my son always comes home having learned new words, colors, shapes or just singing a new song. He loves to go to school and loves to be with his friends. All the kids I see usually are really happy and smiling. He moved up into classes with older kids at times which I appreciated because in order for him to learn to crawl or even walk, it was helpful for him to see other kids who were already doing those thing so he could mimic what they did. We love the staff and the hours and I feel confident that he is taken care and truthfully the teachers as a whole are not appreciated as much as they should be because it's a hard job and not everyone can handle that stress. We have recommended this school to numerous friends who have their kids now and it is nice for us to watch them grow up together.

name: Stacey McIntyre
text: Great school for many reasons:  they teach children in a loving way to read,, write, exhibit good character traits, have a love for learning Biblical lessons along with wonderful teachers, staff and owners.  And the cherry on top....at a reasonable price for what all you get!!

name: Autumn Hiett
text: My son is 10 months old now and started at Grace in the guppy class at the Ridge location. We loved the teachers and that class so much. One morning when he was in the guppy class I was dropping off my son and the lead teacher of sea turtles was opening that class. My son had a blow out so the teacher was changing him and I was standing there helping her. As I’m talking to her she is taking his clothes off and then begins to use his outfit to wipe his stool off his entire body. His outfit ended up having to be thrown away because after three washes it was stained. I mentioned it to the admin and the director and nothing was done. Everything was great until he moved up to the sea turtle class. We did not want him moving up to that class because he was only about 7.5 months old. He wasn’t even crawling, but was attempting to crawl. They kept pushing me to move him up even though I expressed my feelings towards it several times. They stated he was “too big” for the guppy class and he couldn’t fit in the swings anymore. He was a 7.5 month old who couldn’t even crawl, in a class full of 1 year olds who are walking. After he moved up to the sea turtle class we started having issues instantly. The lead teacher would tell me what to do and not to do with my son. He came home with three knots on his head over the period of time from when he moved up until this week. Nobody called me to inform me that he had hit his head either. When I picked him up the teachers or admin staff would state they didn’t know how he got the knots and bruises on his head. Also, every day when I pick up my sons nose is crusted with snot. It clearly hadn’t been whipped off all day. His clothes would be covered in the foods they had eaten that day too. Several times I would have to change his clothes and clean him up before leaving because he looked so bad. On many occasions he came home with 3 out of 4 bottles still filled with formula that I had pre made that morning. The teachers would state he refused to eat. Let me mention that my now 10 month old is 27 lbs, he doesn’t miss a meal. When I would pack his bottles up to leave he would get so excited like he wanted one, so I would give him one and he would drink it so fast like he hadn’t eaten all day because he hadn’t. They only gave him one bottle for an entire 10 hours. When my son was close to 9 months old he came home for a week straight throwing up randomly and having bad stools. I finally took him to the doctor thinking he was sick. I came back to the daycare the following week and told his teacher that his doctor said he was fine. That is when I find out that his lead teacher had been giving him whole milk with his formula without asking me or even telling me for an entire week. What if my kid was allergic or I didn’t want him to have milk? The doctor even recommends children not have whole milk till they are a year old. I expressed my feelings towards her stating all my concerns about it and she states in that class they train the children on whole milk. I told her not to give it to him anymore but I would find out from the other teachers that she continued to give it to him. One day I had to pick my son up during nap time for a doctors appt and she told me to shhh that I would wake the children up. Let me mention I was whispering asking how my son was that day. The same teacher has gotten a stern tone with two of the other kids in his class while I was in there talking to her during drop off, so it makes me wonder how she is talking to my son without me there. These are only a few things that have happened. The director was aware but never did anything about it.

name: Jenifer Phelps
text: Wonderful place! Our daughter loves it here. She is always talking about her school now. She's learned so much since she started. She talks about all her friends, water day, her teachers, and about the songs and lessons she's learned at school.

name: Melissa Jackson
text: Great place to work!!!! Great place for your child/children!!!!

name: Jamie Rathbone
text: They are so wonderful with my girls my three year old girl hated it to start with but two wonderful teachers have her loving big girls school and Dottie is just a wonderful lady very easy to work with I'm just thankful for a good place for my children to go and I totally recommend them

name: Malena Warren
text: My daughter attended the location in Madison. The staff there lacked the training, education, care or simply the common sense to recognize that my child was in respiratory distress. In fact one member of staff stated “yea I was thinking it was asthma”. They did however recognize that she had a fever. To add insult to injury they have yet to call and check on her as we continue to sit in pediatric ICU for now 3 days. I excused A LOT of the behaviors this location displayed from loosing my child’s belongings, to putting other children’s belongings on my child repeatedly, to giving her foods they were told not to give her, but not recognizing that a child is not breathing well is inexcusable!

name: Anna Kinton
text:
My daughter was one of the first kids to start attending when they opened the first location. In the beginning, it was great! It was what I as a single mother desperately needed. It went downhill fast.

There were many times that the meal I sent with her was not used and they started charging me for the extra meal. I had to work at putting a stop to this. The meals, at least in the beginning, were told to me as being "organically catered" but that was clearly not true or had fallen away pretty quickly.

At the time, we were vegetarian - which was on her paperwork and discussed with the owner. But I learned from my reluctant daughter, who was worried she would be in trouble, that there were many times she would be required to finish her whole meal to get dessert, which included chicken nuggets. That is a ridiculous position to put a small child in.

When I reached out via email to discuss the issue, one of the co-owners - Joey - essentially said I was lying and said no child is ever forced to eat something they don't want and did not investigate it or properly address the issue. Funny, because he wasn't even there most of the time. I still have those emails to this day.

There was also the issue of her meds not being given to her and being routinely "forgotten."

Debra-someone rose to being in charge and she was a very cold and rude person. Despite always paying my bill on time and being one of the original customers, she began requiring me to prepay - something which other parents I spoke with did not have to do. But interestingly enough, it was after I had raised concerns about the food issue and then the medicine issue.

At one point, I had to be out of work for a month because my daughter had caught from the daycare strains of influenza, strep, staph, and had a full blown case of MONO. I had never heard of anyone having mono younger than a high-schooler! It was made obvious then that they do not clean well enough.

The last and final straw was the lack of care and protection from the teachers. Despite being the older kid most of the time, she would get hit a bunch by the younger ones. She would tell the teachers who in turn wouldn't do anything, or she would be the one who got in trouble. I tried coaching her on how to protect herself and what to say, but she had a huge fear around doing anything and getting in trouble. No matter what she did, she said she got in trouble when she tried to stop from being hit or complained about it.

I pulled her out and never took her back. She's almost 13 and still talks about how glad and relieved she is to never have to be at daycare. And sometimes I learn new things about her time there, and I overall regret that she spent any time there since it has been such a shadow in her mind.

This place can't even do the basics. I would never recommend them.

name: Joseph Ayers
text: Awesome child care option! My kids love it here. They love the sweet teachers. They are always bringing things home that they learn about. They are very happy to be dropped off. I feel safe here. It’s new and nice. They always adjust if I need to drop to part time or even if I need time off. Our area is so lucky to have this child care option!!

name: Sybil Gibbons
text: Like some families we do not have family here and KidTowne has helped so much. When we needed a full-time daycare at the last minute KidTowne was there and welcoming. Since our youngest has started school we only need KidTowne during school breaks and whenever mommy and daddy want a date night. Thank you so much for all of the hard work the many conversations and kindness Ms. Deb, Andrew and David.

name: Shivonne Smith
text:
First let me say that this daycare was what I considered to be, my lifesaver in the beginning. This was primarily because of the extended hours of operation. I was working a job in Retail at that time, and did not have the luxury of people lining up to care for my child while I worked. Long story short.....   Several instances where I would pick up my daughter to find her face, nose, clothes, etc. FILTHY. Not once or twice, but over 15-20 times. I always provided change of clothes but they were NEVER used. She was always very thirsty and hungry-as they do not serve dinner until 7 p.m.
I emailed the Director to schedule a meeting with her and the owner, to which she took days to reply. One day before the such meeting, I walked in to find my daughter with a snotty nose as an employee crouched in the corner texting on her cell phone. I was later told that BOTH owners were just TOO busy to meet with me so I sat down with the Director only. She assured me that things would improve. One being their extremely high turn over rate-that did NOT change. My daughter no longer attends this daycare. Please PLEASE do not leave your children with these people. On my daughter's last day there, while not being attended to; another child in her over 2 1/2 yr room shut her hand in a door!!! The Director nor either owner EVER called to say "I'm sorry", "How is she"... NOTHING.
Actions speak VOLUMES.

name: Cody Brewer
text: The best place to leave you child. Rita is exceptionally attentive, and has your child's best interest at heart. The absolute BEST place to have someone watch your child.

name: brittany ortiz
text: My daughter is 4 years old and is always happy to go to Kidtowne. We love the flexibility of being able to use it 7 days a week as our schedules vary. We use it for our 9 year old as well when we need a "sitter". Every person that works there is friendly. I also appreciate that it does not have a bad odor, as some childcare places do. I recommend Kidtowne to many people moving to Madison and consider it a great asset to the community.

name: Anonymous User
text: i love bringing my child here because she learns so much! The staff is so friendly,  I do Rita and Ashley were still working here though!

name: MELANIE M (Somewhere Alabama)
text: I myself would not take my children there. All food is cooked using a microwave. I Know to ask every day care how meals are prepared now.

name: Anon feth
text: I really don't think these people are qualified to run a daycare. Also, the "teachers" they hire to watch your children are very young and have practically no experience. Drop your kids off at your own risk, I'm surprised they haven't been shut down. I'll be calling DHR.

resp.text: We are sorry that you had a poor experience. We do not feel that the experience described is typical of the care provided here at KidTowne. Many of our teachers have degrees in early childhood education and all participate in rigorous training. Please give us a call if there is anything further we can do to help resolve your concerns and pinpoint any specific events.

name: Guy Hippleheuser
text: We have two kids that have attended KidTowne for several months and can't say enough good things about the staff. We shopped around for the best daycare when we moved to the area and have to say that we made the right choice!

name: Beyond Nail Spa
text: Very clean and nice place. I love the flexible hours and people work here.

name: Breanna Harris
text: This place is so dirty they do not use sanitizer for anything. The bathrooms are always dirty. They don’t make sure that the kids are cleaned after they use the bathroom or that they was their hands. The owners are never there. They just assume. They don’t take pride in their daycare. It smells like dirty diapers all the time. I wouldn’t send my child their at all. Plus this day care doesn’t even have a oven. They only have microwave food and it’s not what they tell you they kids will be having for the week. They don’t have dish detergent to wash dishes. They just dip the dishes in some type of water solution. Their is still food that will be left on the dishes. It’s a lot of mess that’s in that building and they don’t pay enough for the work they ask for.  If i were I’d take my child anywhere but there.

name: Stan Reese
text: We have never worried when we dropped our kids off here. The staff seems to love kids and our kids always have fun.

resp.text: Thanks for the review! We always enjoy having your sweet kids around!

name: Mr Information
text: Walked in and saw kids bottles propped up with baby quilts and other propping tools. Small babies on the floor making it easy to trip and fall or drop something on the kids. Madison location is horrible

resp.text: We are very sorry that you had a negative experience. Please give us a call and speak with a manager. Propped bottles are certainly against our policy. We would like more information and an opportunity to resolve your concern.

name: Lydia Pinkston Gray
text: Really really terrible staff. They didn't know how to handle a 3 year old tantrum and called me to come and get him because he was "scaring the other students". Then they told me that he was not welcome back. His tantrum was because he had bit his tongue, and it was hurting, and they were trying to make him eat. If you are going to run a daycare, you need to know how to handle a young child breakdown. It is GOING to happen, guaranteed. The two owners have no idea what they are doing, one had only WORKED in a daycare a handful of years before deciding to open his own, and the other one wouldn't even disclose his history. If you drop your kid off here, who knows what kind of care they are getting.

resp.text: Mrs. Pinkston, We see that your child last attended in 2013. Please give us a call so that we can resolve your concerns. We would be more than happy to share with you information concerning the degrees and experience of our owners as well as our staff.

name: Jessica Jackson
text: We absolutely love Kidtowne!  Everyone is very friendly and my son loves going there!

name: Margerita Martinez
text: I drop my niece off here often and she loves the staff. The facility is very clean and friendly!!

name: Ashlee Eastham
text: Our daughter has been here since she was like 8 weeks old. She's 2 now and our experience has been amazing. All of her teachers have been sweet and great with the kids. When I go pick her up, I never hear tons of crying kids. They are happy! Can't reccomend enough.

name: LeeAnn
text: Both of my kids have been going here since they were 11 weeks old, my oldest is 4 yrs old now and we love it here. The teachers are attentive and loving towards the kids. I’ve never had a bad experience with anyone who works here. I love that the infants have their own building and individual outside play areas. The owners, Pam and Tina are great and are always available to answer any questions we may have. It’s been a great daycare for my family and I would highly recommend them to anyone!

name: Stephen Walls
text: I think it's important to note that every bad review for Slaughter Road CDC was written by someone who DOES NOT have kids there. Their lack of response to phone calls is likely because they're being attentive to the kids that are there! Teachers are quick to give you their personal numbers for reaching them and they are quick to contact the parents when necessary. We have had our son here for nearly 2 years and it has been nothing but a great experience. It is a wonderful small-family atmosphere and they have helped our son grow and mature so well. I'm always impressed at the new skills he learns every week!

name: Courtney Warner
text: I have 4 kids and they each went to daycare here, starting in 2012 up to now. We tried other places before this one, and this is hands down the best daycare I have ever known. I absolutely love the staff. It's a family business run by mother and daughter for over 30 years. Very small classes. The "baby building" has 8 rooms divided by age from newborn to 2 yrs old - average class size is 4-6 kids. The other building has 4 large classrooms, again divided by age from 2 to 5 - average class size 8-12 kids. All of the teachers are kind, responsible, and loving. I have never heard a teacher yell at a kid, my kids have never come home with injuries. As a matter of fact, they adored each of their teachers. You can tell by a kid's reactions whether someone is treating them right. And my kids would run up to their teachers to hug them in the morning. Even now, when we go pick up little brother, the older kids want to go in and say hello to their old teachers. I am an obnoxiously overprotective mom, and this is the one place where I can leave my baby and still have peace of mind. These people care for the kids like their own. They are down to earth and easy to communicate with. I think it's more than just a daycare/school for the kids, its like a home away from home. We have been absolutely blessed!

name: Courtney Brooke
text: I see quite a few reviews on here about rude and unresponsive staff. I called the center at 0630 in the morning. The lady who answered the phone was very sweet. They didn’t have any openings for my sons age, but she gave me a few other suggestions for places that might. Very long waiting list but in my opinion that really says something about this center.

name: Iman Jones
text: i want there as a pre schooler and for daycare and it was the best experience ever

name: Grace Chen
text: Both of my kids went there. We all love the daycare and the teachers who really care about the kids. I also like the small class size for little ones, as it definitely helped preventing little ones from getting sick frequently. Most of the teachers are there with the owner for a long long time. We used a fancier daycare before, but the turnover rate was so high, for a 9 month period, my 2 year-old had 5 teachers.

name: Jason Manthey
text:
My wife and I have been looking for a day care and have tried to call this place about 4 times. My wife has left a message with her phone number asking for a return call and info, I’ve left a couple messages with the same. Makes you wonder what would happen if your kids were there and you needed to contact the day care about an emergency.

I guess you guys have answered our questions with your lack of answering our questions. It’s too bad because your location would have been incredibly convienant for us.

name: Rhonda Woods
text: My 1 year old grandson had bruises around his neck, scratches on his chest and face. No one could provide any information as to what happened. Management was unconcerned and nonchalant. DO NOT BRING YOUR KIDS HERE!!!! Pay a little extra for a peace of mind. This place is a NIGHTMARE.

name: Brian Spoonire
text: Office is easy to find at 501 Princeton, and they have a whole children's-sized 2 acre campus complete with a little playground.

name: Belinda Washington
text: Worst daycare I have ever known. They DO NOT take good care of your kids. My grandbaby  went there for a week, every day  he was wet and hungry when I picked him up. The owner and workers need their ASS KICKED

name: Laura Brooks
text: Awesome! Everyone there is so kind and caring.  My children love going there.  The past 5 years have been wonderful!

name: Ashley Bates
text: Do not send your child here. They don't pay attention to the children. My daughter had rocks thrown at her at the playground and no one was paying attention. My daughter cried and begged not to go back. Today while my grandmother dropped her off she witnessed NO ONE paying attention while another child hit another child and tries to knocked them down. Unless you want your child bullied while the workers aren't paying any attention, DO NOT SEND YOUR CHILD HERE!!!

text: I worked here when it was Milestones. Loved the space, the kids and the experience but the way it was ran was just horrible. They didn’t care about the kids or the teachers. So glad to see it being filled with a loving environment. Miss my 2 and 4 year old room!

name: Anthony Dean
text: BBMA has been fantastic for our infant. We are very happy with her care, but also the communication from the Staff. The Kidreport app lets us keep track of what our baby is doing through the day. We would recommend BBMA to any family looking for a school that is more than just "daycare."

name: Freddy Tate
text: The reason we accepted Big Blue Marble Academy as our child care provider for our son was simply because of first impression. This daycare offers a caring, vibrant, clean and stimulating environment for all kids.

name: Kaylie Hill
text: Love the whole staff here!! They made the transition for both me and my child super easy!

name: Ragan White
text: I am a first time parent, and it can be an anxious experience to start your child in daycare. I recently enrolled my son here under the new ownership of Big Blue Marble and I could not be happier with this facility! He is being engaged every day, and when I get him home he is so much more animated and talkative (as much as one can be for 4 months old). The staff takes great covid precautions with pickup, dropoffs and the rooms, and they always make it a really fun experience for him and for me every day. I think any time you take your kid to day care you need to expect that they are going to be exposed to more germs and be sick a little more, but that's going to happen whether it be day care, preschool, kindergarten, church or sports. It's unavoidable if you want your child to interact with the world outside of your home. If you are looking for a learning center / day care that offers real engagement, wonderful teachers and staff, and parent peace of mind - I highly recommend Big Blue Marble on e Glenn!

name: K. Moore
text: My daughter worked there a few years ago during college. She had a terrible experience. She was sick so often that we made her quit! She often had worker kids which made her number of children per adult be over regulation. Toys were not cleaned effectively. I’d suggest looking elsewhere or you’ll end up paying for daycare and taking sick days from work to take care of your child.

name: Shashank Rao
text:
We have tried Milestones on two separate occasions - first when our son was an infant (8 weeks to 4 months old) and now when he turned 18 months old.  Both times the experience was HORRIBLE (not sure why we even decided to give them a second chance after the first time's issues). As an infant, he was sick every alternate week while at Milestones.  One week he would go to Milestones and catch something, then we would keep him home for a week and fix him up.  The next week he would catch something else again.  It was a perpetual cycle because of which we decided to pull him out.

He then restarted daycare (somewhere else) when he was a year old.  For 6 months he was relatively healthy - barring the occasional cough / cold.  We started him back at Milestones this week (i.e. 18  months).  He has been there all of 3 days and already he has caught a stomach bug. This place is horrible!  On day 1 when we went to pick him up, his milk cup was not washed and just sitting around.  The second day, his pacifier was missing.  When I asked the teacher where his pacifier was, she started looking among the toys.  That should have been my first clue - if the teacher is looking for a pacifier amongst the toys, god alone knows how many kids have put it in their mouth!  And the pacifier had a string attached to it, so they could just have clipped it to our son, but they did not care to do that.  The "teachers" as such are a bunch of college kids, and most of them have no clue what they are doing.  As such, it is a revolving door for teachers; there is so much turnover that almost anyone you speak with says they are new.  If you care for your child's health, please stay away from this place!

name: Abby Wang
text: Their facility is very new, so it looks good if you take a tour as a first time visitor. My child kept getting sick during his stay, and I had to withdraw him from the center after I found him another place. They use plugin air fresheners with VERY STRONG scent, even an adult would feel very uncomfortable while staying in the room. I was really worried that my son's health might be hazarded by those chemical stuff. Are those things allowed to be used in a childcare center by regulation? Also, their playground is paved with pebbles, which is ridiculous and rather unsafe for outdoor activities!

name: alexis winston
text:
Bad experience while working there the staff was very awful towards me , a few girls I've known that worked there never received their money after working for weeks and  definitely my last check wasnt given to me with all my hours
recommend new directors in the front office.

text: Both of my kids started at Ardent at 8 weeks of age and it could not have been a better decision for my family! The love and care the staff at Ardent provides goes beyond what I could have asked for! These ladies truly care for my littles and want to see them flourish and grow, not only academically, but in their walk with Jesus!

name: Jennifer Jones
text: Ardent Preschool offers the one thing we absolutely need as parents.  A safe, clean environment that we can leave our children at while we work with a great staff and an amazing learning experience.  My children thrived at Ardent.

name: William McKoy
text: Sent an email to the owner of Ardent explaining to him some complaints that we had. Gave him several days to reply to my complaints. It was not until AFTER I left a review that he emails me and asks me to remove my review. Really unprofessional leadership starting at the top.

name: deanna edmondson
text: Very clean facility, friendly admin, and fun center! My children love attending and get excited to see their teachers and friends!

name: Ky maria Rich

If I could give it 10 starts I would.

I love it. My children love it

name: Sassy Sophia

name: Kristen Burgin

name: Tracy W

text: Mrs. Ruby is the sweetest person alive!

name: Travis “ttow” Tow
text: Excellent pre-k program.  Could not be happier with my daughter's development while she attended Somerville Baptist Pre-K.  Careing staff and challenging curriculum.

name: Travis “ttow” Tow
text: This is a great daycare/pre-school.  Caring staff, secure facility, smart curriculum for all age groups.

name: Tee W
text: I received a call that our baby had an allergic reaction outside.  When we picked him up his lip was swollen and he had scratches on his face.  When we got home and removed his clothes,  his body was covered in red bruises.  There was also a purple bruise on his thigh.   He was also very hoarse.  We contacted the school and doctors office.  Because my son had allergies and he was so young we wanted to confirm if the marks were injuries or allergies.  The dr and nurse both said bruises.  Additionally he was seen by 3 other drs. ALL agreed. They also said he was hoarse from screaming all day.  This school went "all out" covering up what really happened to my 20 month child! Lied,  said video was broken that day,  and even changed their stories.  I was more hurt than anything being this was a Christian establishment! Needless to say we still have no clue what happened.  PLEASE BEWARE.  Things happen but if NO ONE KNOWS what's going on when your precious babies are left in the care of "trained adults" that is totally unacceptable.

name: Debra Banks
text: I'm a first time mom and when I dropped my child off I cried ...a lot. By his grace infant teachers make have put my mind at ease since I enrolled my child. Ive gotten a phone call ensuring my child was okay, I heard my child cooing over the phone and even sent pictures of my child. So far they have gone out of there to help a first time mom like myself to put the parents mind at ease. That ensures they care about the child and parent as well as business.

name: Alexander Pena
text: This place is awesome! The owner is easy to talk to and all of the teachers go above and beyond for my children. Very satisfied

name: Desma Maria
text: My kids have been here for a while now and I can't complain.

name: S
text: Very kind and caring staff! The children are very well taken care of! Kids are treated like family! Nice & clean facility. We wouldn’t go anywhere else! We highly recommend St. Luke’s!

name: Chaney’s Dream
text: All 3 of my children attended this daycare. Great friendly staff that always made me feel comfortable leaving my children in there care. I would highly recommend.

name: Kenzz
text: It was a very good school for me. I miss st. Luke so much the teachers were very nice they helped me learn a lot they took time and good care of the children definitely a great place to go! 🙃

name: Prada 0825
text: My children go here and they are wonderful. It feels like family is taking care of your kids. My child didn’t get into pre-k and I was so glad they did a program for pre-k! He learned so much! My children have gone here from 6 weeks to 5 years old. I am not sure what some previous reviews are talking about. They are never outside in the hottest part of the day from 11-3:30 and they make sure they are hydrated. I am glad my kids get to go outside and play because they love it and I don’t have much time to take them. They also bring home all kinds of crafts. I don’t have any complaints and their prices are great!

name: Amy Ervin
text: Both of my children attended the daycare facility here and loved it.  The employees are kind and attentive, and my children were treated with loving care the four years that each of them attended St. Luke Daycare.

name: Michael Parham
text: Kind, loving people who genuinely care about preschool teachings but also the lessons of life and eternity.......

name: Chip Ervin
text: If there was a church from the movie Deliverence, this would be it.. Same members have been going here for 10-15 year with no new faces. "Wonder Why" One member who's name is Janice Voss, also on the board, in the choir, and is one of The United Methodist Woman is the worse hypocrite in The Deep South. I chalanged her and Amy Gay Ervin to go to a professional Christian mediator for family counseling, but they were to ignorant in their beliefs to go. Our last visit was this past Easter, my fiancé and I went because that's were my children attend. We were shunned by 75% of the congregation. I have nothing good to say about this church, other than an elderly couple "Bill and Ellen Flowers" it's my opinion, they are two of the most wonderful Christians in the world!  I hope this church makes some major changes, because they're giving Christians a bad name.

name: Russell Cox
text: Our twin 2 year olds go here and day in and day out they are outside in this 100 degree weather almost all day!! This is ridiculous. Not to mention barely ANY a/c inside either! Our kids come home everyday so lethargic because they’re exhausted from being in the heat all day long!! My suggestion don’t use their daycare!

name: Kayela Elders
text: Being a past employee I caution people about this place. I would not put my own child in this facility. The faculty can get rude with the children and negligent. I saw this first hand. There are so many kids and so few staff and how things are ran are very chaotic. Please look else where for child care.

name: Rachel Jones
text: I have both of my boys here for over a year. We love all of the staff (they keep me sane too) and my boys give nothing but smiles at drop off and pick up. My oldest is ready for Kindergarten through their program and my youngest is learning something new every day too. Blessed to have found them.

name: daniel sylvester
text: Let me say that when my son first started here we loved the staff and more importantly my son loved going to daycare but this past Tuesday all that changed when we were told Tuesday morning that he wasn't allowed back because he wasn't a good fit. All my son talked about was getting to see his friends at school everyday he was so happy and it breaks my heart that he's not able to get to do that anymore. We were never gave any warnings this just came from out of the blue and the way it was handled was very unprofessional I've lost all respect for the owner and staff. My son is 3 and yes he likes to goof off and thinks everything is funny but today when I picked him up from his new make shift baby sitter he is crying because he didn't get to see his friends and he misses them.  So to the owner I hope you can sleep at night after screwing people over giving them less than 24 hours to find someone to keep my son.

name: Alex Resendez
text: Great teachers who really care about the kids they take care of and awesome environment with lots of activities for all the age groups. Would defintley recommend them.

name: Dianne Castillo
text: They are amazing!!!

name: Courtney Green
text: Great people great facility
